Cellulitis.detail: Cellulitis is a bacterial infection of the skin and tissues beneath the skin.
Cellulitis.precautions: Keep wounds clean, avoid scratching, maintain good hygiene.
Cellulitis.treatment: Antibiotic therapy, rest, elevation of affected area.

Impetigo.detail: Impetigo is a contagious skin infection that causes red sores.
Impetigo.precautions: Avoid close contact, wash hands frequently, do not share towels.
Impetigo.treatment: Topical or oral antibiotics as prescribed.

Athlete's Foot.detail: A fungal infection that usually begins between the toes.
Athlete's Foot.precautions: Keep feet dry, avoid walking barefoot in public showers.

Nail Fungus.detail: A fungal infection of the fingernails or toenails.
Nail Fungus.precautions: Keep nails trimmed and dry, avoid damp shoes.
Nail Fungus.treatment: Oral antifungal medication, medicated nail polish.

Ringworm.detail: A common fungal infection that causes a circular rash.
Ringworm.precautions: Avoid skin-to-skin contact, don't share personal items.
Ringworm.treatment: Antifungal creams, powders, or oral medication.

Cutaneous Larva Migrans.detail: A skin disease caused by hookworm larvae migration.
Cutaneous Larva Migrans.precautions: Avoid walking barefoot in sandy or moist soil.
Cutaneous Larva Migrans.treatment: Antiparasitic medications like albendazole or ivermectin.

Chickenpox.detail: A viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash.
Chickenpox.precautions: Avoid contact with infected individuals, vaccination.
Chickenpox.treatment: Antihistamines for itching, antiviral drugs in severe cases.

Shingles.detail: A reactivation of the chickenpox virus causing painful rash.
Shingles.precautions: Vaccination, avoid contact with people who haven't had chickenpox.
